intro: Anchusella variegata, commonly known as the variegated anchusella, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive veining pattern. Anchusella variegata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
